address.streetAddress: 1575 Lake Shore Blvd W Budapest Park

description: Oceah Oceah is a stand up paddle boarding (SUP) company in Toronto. It's owned and operated by Indigenous sisters with a passion to create community and connect people of all nations with and to water. With two locations, the first at Budapest Park in Torontos western beaches and at Bluffers Park in Scarborough. They offer engaging and fun lessons and tours of the Humber River. Explore the lakeshore and river while gaining a new perspective of the city and connection to the water, wildlife and natural environment. Rentals available every day from sunrise to sunset- pre-booking required through the website.

reviews.title: Relaxing and Therapeutic!
text: Amazing vibes from start to finish! Came with the fam jam.  Jen from Oceah Oceah team greeted us with open arms.  Gave a quick, thorough, and beginner-friendly training on paddle boarding.  Ideal location for,much needed, outdoor fun. Toronto views galore from your board.. Sun energy recharge complete!  Bonding time with my kids succeeded.  Affordable pricing...Customer retention accomplished! Highly recommendable!

reviews.title: Best Outdoor Beach Activity in Toronto
text: Oceah Oceah is a SUP rental, tour and lesson business and its amazing. The owner/operator Jen is smart, easy going and very knowledgeable. I highly recommend Oceah Oceah!
This summer I was there often and it was a great physical activity to stay physically distant and I was impressed with the thorough sanitization protocols.

Please note you are required to be able to lift the board and be able to carry it to the water, and prior experience is required for a rental. If you have no experience, you should take a lesson for everyone's peace of mind. The lessons are great value and there are a few instructors who are all excellent and both are certified.
I tell everyone about Oceah Oceah, its a fun way to work on your tan, keep fit and have fun. Ceck it out for a fun experience and a crew that makes you feel like an old friend.
10 stars!

reviews.title: Fun
text: Good paddling in West Toronto. Jen is knowledgeable and very helpful.  I really enjoyed and would go to Oceah Oceah again.

reviews.title: Magical
text: This is the top SUP rental/tour establishment in Toronto! The bus it is run out of is cute and well thought out. Jen and her staff are knowledgeable and are great teachers on and off the water.‚ô•Ô∏èüåä

reviews.title: Amazing experience!
text: This was my first time paddel boarding, I felt completely comfortable, with Osha Osha! Jen was knowledge about the water in the area and gave easy to understand instructions. I will definitely be going again.

reviews.title: Osha osha provides the best SUP in Toronto!
text: If you are visiting Toronto during the summer, I strongly recommend that you go paddle boarding with Osha osha! I am an marginally fit American visiting from New York City for the Canada Day weekend and I‚Äôve spent two of my five scheduled days there, it‚Äôs that good ‚ù§Ô∏è

I was nervous about SUP when my friend who is a local recommended we paddle on Canada Day. I‚Äôve only done SUP one time before and I couldn‚Äôt even stand on the board, but my friend told me Jen and her company Osha osha would change how I feel about it. We did the Humber river tour and it started with an orientation on how to use paddles and boards and once we got into the water, how steer,  sit and stand (!) on the board. When I couldn‚Äôt stand the last time, this time I felts confident and prepared enough by Osha osha. I padded,  staring out towards the horizon, feeling free and strong. I spent most of those first couple of hours sitting, however and that was wonderful too.
It felt so good physically and mentally, that we rented boards the next day and went out during sunset! Gorgeous views and the water was calm!

Not going to lie: a couple of times I started feeling anxious and wanted to turn around because of how far we were going during the tour. I didn‚Äôt realize I had it in me to do this 2+ hour tour and Jen‚Äôs patience and confidence building support calmed me down and I was able to push myself

Osha osha provided an amazingly fun and safe way to enjoy Toronto‚Äôs waterways. The lake was a beautiful, serene, clean and COOL on the 94F/33C degree days. Although I‚Äôve visited before Toronto in the summer before, I‚Äôm sorry that I never got to enjoy connecting with the water until now.

Beyond the excellent board and paddle selection, convenient Western beach location to Downtown and calm waters, Jen‚Äôs care, consideration and instruction really make Osha osha a great business to support if you want SUP. I highly recommend!

reviews.title: Yes!
text: I loved to end my Toronto trip with the stand-up-paddling introduction! Jennifer was really kind & the paddling on this river with view was beautiful! Thank you! Recommend it! Will definitely do it again if I would return to Toronto!

reviews.title: Osha Osha is wonderful
text: I joined the Thursday Socials with Osha Osha. This is the best way to learn SUP paddling in a very friendly and welcoming environment.
Jennifer loves what she does, brings in a great attitude and is amazingly helpful to the beginners.  Also as a part of the social, you meet with some amazing people.
I signed up for the month of July but might continue in August as well.
Besides the socials,  Osha Osha also has some other programs that can be checked out as well.
Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great Paddling Experience!
text: Great experience! Jen was very patient with me, as it was my first time and I was not a quick study :). She showed great knowledge and expertise on the technical aspects of Paddleboarding as well as the more health/spiritual benefits that the activity brings. Her equipment was all top notch and in really good shape. Her prices are very competitive for this type of service. Finally, the location at the west Toronto lakeshore is ideal because the barricades calm the waves, making for a smooth serene boarding experience. Thanks Jen!

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: Our group of 4 really enjoyed the Intro to SUP & Yoga class with Jenifer! She was a great instructor, professional and fun. It felt like we were out on the water with one of our friends. SUP is really fun and great way to spend a morning, and doing yoga on a paddle board was very peaceful. I would recommend this class and Jenifer, it was a great summer activity!

reviews.title: Fun times paddling at Sunnyside
text: Jen and crew were professional and fun during our paddle session.  There are a variety of boards to choose from and Jen had lots of tips for new and intermediate paddlers.  Definitely plan on visiting again.

reviews.title: Family fun
text: We had an amazing time with the lovely Jenifer learning how to paddle board down at Sunnyside beach. The sun was setting, the lake was tranquil and the relaxed approach she brought to the occasion meant it was a very chilled experience - despite my nerves! The children took to it very easily and had a great experience. We would highly recommend it as a fun thing to do on a lovely summer evening.

reviews.title: Paddletour
text: Randomly discovered Jenifer and Osha when it first opened,  like 3 summers ago now.
I love those random occurrences that end of being amazing decisions and experiences.

I've paddled with Jen for 3 summers now.  She has an extensive background in water sports and just about water in general (ask her about the pollution levels at Sunnyside, I dare you!)  She gives you the tools needed to have the best experience out on the water, whether it's your first time or you're a veteran at paddling.
Overall, a really awesome experience, a great way to get out of the city (without getting out of the city) - and the added bonus of working on your tan?  Total win!

reviews.title: Amazing!!
text: Jenn has lead all the paddles I've been on with OSHA and she is amazing! She gave a great lesson with solid knowledge. And she is just a blast! I love the homely and loving vibe she brings to every paddle. I typically go out about 4-5 times a summer, more if I can! Will always recommend OSHA!

reviews.title: Paddle yoga, blissful
text: Wonderful way to connect body, breath, mind and nature! After taking an intro lesson with osha, I was ready to bring my yoga practice onto the board. I joined a morning paddle flow yoga class and found the experience so beautiful, it was a challenge but really fun, we even ended the class with a relaxation pose lying on our backs with our eyes closed as the teacher guided us around and kept us from bumping into anything. The experience was so peaceful!

reviews.title: Beautiful
text: A beautiful way to see the city while connecting with nature. The lesson was taught by a knowledgable and certified instructor but felt more like a relaxing getaway from the city. it's worth the trip over the highway to get on the water.

reviews.title: Paddle Tour
text: Went on the Humber River paddle tour. Had an amazing time and it was such a good idea for something active and different to do on the weekend. It really feels like you have briefly left the city. Pretty easy to pick up and you definitely don't need to have done anything similar before. Only thing I would say is bring some water if its really hot!

reviews.title: Osha Osha makes
text: I look forward to every summer in Toronto by paddling on the Lakeshore. I have to say this is great way of getting away without the leaving the city.
The website is easy to navigate, register, and book.

Jen is easy to communicate with and has a super zen vibe. Her clear and simple instruction makes a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. She will also get you  out of your comfort zone while also ensuring your safety.
Her paddles under the Humber Bay Bridge and to the Humber River (not as scary as it sounds) makes it so worth it as if you're in another part of Ontario.
Because she is surfer girl she takes pictures of you on her iphone so you can catch all moments on the board and posts them on her facebook!

Jen is also a yoga teacher and sometimes you get a lil comp yoga. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to try something different and not so touristy and off the beaten path. You will be hooked like me!

reviews.title: Awesome day on the water
text: Absolutely amazing experience.  So peaceful and tranquil.  I didn't fall in once, but I was close! Thanks to our great instructor Jenifer for her great tuition. Will be definitely back!

reviews.title: Perfect! First Time SUP'ing - Bachelorette Party
text: Jenifer was amazing to deal with and helped to provide a special experience for our soon-to-be Bride and the the entire bridal party!

Friendly, organized and knowledgeable from the start - Jenifer dealt with our group of 7 women perfectly: Taking time to make sure everyone was comfortable before entering the water, lending extra attention to our Bachelorette, and offering to snap pictures throughout the entire lesson. We were all beginners, and she was able to push us to try new things without making anyone feel like the lesson was out of their reach. Her experience and knowledge of SUP and Yoga was obvious the second we met. We ended the session with a series of relaxing sun salutations and a photoshoot by the beach! Exactly what us instagram-loving group wanted. Each one of us left the parking lot feeling accomplished and proud, vowing to come back with our boyfriends, moms and friends ASAP!
A laid-back, professional, friendly and FUN instructor; I recommend Jenifer and Osha Osha to anyone looking to plan there next fun-in-the-sun get event!

reviews.title: The best part of my summer!
text: I started paddle boarding with Osha in July and I can't get enough. Jenifer leads a challenging yet peaceful class - she is so patient and makes sure your experience on the water is a great one.

reviews.title: More please
text: Jen is a calm and patient instructor. She led a wonderful couple of hours on Lake Ontario.  I look forward to joining her again at some great spots that she knows well.  I'm from Toronto and discovering there are some gems for paddleboarding I didnt  know about.

reviews.title: Fun experience
text: Jenifer sets up a nice SUP experience in downtown Toronto. It was my first time and I really enjoyed.

reviews.title: Felt like walking on water, except better!
text: Jennifer gave a good rundown before hitting up the lake. Good meetup location, steps away from the beach. My friend and I took the intro, and both felt super relaxed after. I would definitely consider doing the Humber Tour, after.

reviews.title: We Love Osha
text: Each year we plan a group SUP and yoga event with OSHA.  Our guests appreciate walking on water with Jenifer who is a patient and caring teacher helping empower and inspire all ages and abilities to get out and explore.  Mix in a little yoga and its bliss.

reviews.title: So much fun! A great morning on the water
text: My sister and I were having a girls weekend and wanted to do something active outdoors that wasn't going to be to strenuous - Paddle Flow Yoga was perfect. Jenifer was an amazing instructor, making both my sister and I feel completely comfortable and confident on our boards (we were first-time paddle boarders). I'd 110% recommend this. I can't wait to do it again.

reviews.title: Perfect Summer Evening
text: My husband and I did the intro class and both loved it. I've paddleboarded a few times before, he had never- and Jenifer did a great job of managing our respective levels of comfort. Her equipment and approach was heads and tails above other paddleboard instructors I've had and she was super pleasant and personable. It was the perfect balance between a lesson, experience and a workout- 100% enjoyable!
It's also a really unique way to experience Toronto,making it great for Torontonians and visitors.
I'll be taking more classes soon-Highly recommend!
